heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike was on 13 May 2025, at a distance of 4.97 miles.

storm.status: The last storm was on 16 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (206°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.7°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 189 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1286 m) and feels like temperature (down 1.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 188.7m lower than yesterday, 706.2m lower than the past week, 1285.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 689m to a maximum of 1098m, averaging 680.5m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1386.7m and 1966.4m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and very little to no wind will be present. Chance of light rain, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
